Create empty MizerParams object of the right size

Source: R/MizerParams-class.R
emptyParams.Rd

Sets up a MizerParams object in which most slots are left empty. Only the size grids as well as the species names and gear names are set up.

emptyParams(no_sp, min_w = 0.001, max_w = 1000, no_w = 100,
  min_w_pp = 1e-10, no_w_pp = NA, species_names = 1:no_sp,
  gear_names = species_names, resource_names = list())

Arguments

no_sp

Number of species
min_w

Smallest weight. Default 0.001
max_w

Start of largest weight brackt. Default 1000.
no_w

Number of fish weight brackets. Default 100.
min_w_pp

Smallest plankton weight. Default 1e-10. This determines how many size bins are created for the plankton spectrum.
no_w_pp

No longer used
species_names

Names of species
gear_names

Names of gears
resource_names

Names of unstructured resources. Empty if the model does not contain unstructured resource components.

Value

An empty but valid MizerParams object

Details

This will produce a valid MizerParams object with all the slots initialised but filled with meaningless placeholders values, except for the size grid slots. The dimension names of the array slots are correctly set using the weight grid and species and gear names.

A size grid is created so that the log-sizes are equally spaced. The spacing is chosen so that there will be `no_w` fish size bins, with the smallest starting at `min_w` and the largest starting at `max_w`. For `w_full` additional size bins are added between `min_w_pp` and `min_w`, with the same log size. Because `min_w` is always a size-bin boundary, in general due to the fixed bin size the smallest size bin may start a bit above `min_w_pp`.

Contents

  • Arguments
  • Value
  • Details
